name: NPR
text:
Some U.S. hospitals have been hit by coordinated ransomeware attacks designed to infect their systems and extort money, federal agencies warned on Wednesday.
https://t.co/Eoo0qFFRno

name: NPR
text:
Hurricane Zeta has left more than 2 million customers without electricity. The outages are complicating election plans and bringing hazardous conditions for people waiting in lines to vote early.
https://t.co/FLZTMPi28E

name: NPR
text:
It's projected that up to one-half of New York City's restaurants may close permanently in the next six months to a year. And the coming winter is adding to those mounting financial pressures.
https://t.co/9FATsGTO7K

name: NPR
text:
More than 6 million voters under 30 have cast early ballots so far, compared with roughly 2 million at the same time in 2016.

And the number of first-time voters in that group has doubled in four years.
https://t.co/gUNiMntRdq

name: NPR
text:
Two recent "superspreader events" on Long Island, N.Y., — a wedding and a house party — have led to a total of 56 positive COVID-19 cases and have pushed nearly 300 people into quarantine.
https://t.co/j2JGAKoHEX

name: NPR
text:
Santa Cruz, Calif., is using a new mobile voting center — which looks, essentially, like a food truck — to make it easier for residents to cast their ballots, especially those who've lost their homes in recent wildfires.
https://t.co/vLNSdGDIeJ

name: NPR
text:
Scientists have identified time cells in the human brain that place a sort of time stamp on memories as they form. That allows us to recall sequences of events or life experiences in the right order — much like a movie.  
https://t.co/N4RRX6xBuI

name: NPR
text:
NPR will rely on exclusively on Associated Press calls on Election night and after, in large part because they have a track record of precision and caution. 

Because of mail-in voting, the process for making those calls is a bit different this year: https://t.co/LJ9IJ2crbz

name: NPR
text:
Election officials worried the pandemic would sideline polling sites' traditional older workforce, causing hours-long wait times to vote. 

Thanks to high-profile recruiting efforts, many are now turning volunteers away or training huge reserve workforces. https://t.co/6WqBngUPn6

name: NPR
text: A progressive who plans to vote for Green Party presidential candidate Howie Hawkins. A daughter of immigrants who's all-in on President Trump. Campaigns are rediscovering this year that there is no solid “Latino” bloc. @TPRNews  https://t.co/51jcOZAZuV

name: NPR
text: After 2016, photographer Katie Hayes Luke looked into the gap between the media narrative and voters' private views. Talking with her subjects showed her "we may not agree with each other, but we are all invested in speaking up for a better America." https://t.co/7Wj8FqIpZE

name: NPR
text:
El Paso is one of the country's latest COVID-19 hot spots, with hospitalizations tripling in the past three weeks. 

"We had gone down," says one ER doctor, "and the city was really rejoicing over that. ... As a community, we let down our guard." https://t.co/zIj0S9vT1V

name: NPR
text: A new survey this week found 63% of 18- to 29-year-olds said they would "definitely" vote in the 2020 election. That's far higher than the 2016 number — and another sign that young voters are poised for another record turnout. https://t.co/uchA2rpCzl

name: NPR
text:
More than 8 million people in the U.S. have had confirmed coronavirus infections and more than 225,000 have died of COVID-19. Our maps and charts are tracking the nation's outbreaks.
https://t.co/NlJFqIeHCE

name: NPR
text:
Exclusive: Internal documents obtained by NPR show the federal government collects data that could reveal new COVID-19 hotspots — but keeps it from public view.
https://t.co/wE4Lt65yx5

name: NPR
text:
The final NPR Electoral College map analysis shows Biden going into Election Day with a clear edge, while Trump has a narrow path through key states.
https://t.co/bp9nvAXVxU

name: NPR
text:
With Election Day approaching, experts in global conflict warn that conditions in the U.S. are ripe for conflict — and worry about potential violence if protesters and counter-protesters clash in the streets.
https://t.co/T2XEXrxxh8

name: NPR
text:
These are the 13 races that will determine control of the Senate in the next Congress.
https://t.co/5yPilp6rDH

name: NPR
text:
The U.S. recorded 88,521 new coronavirus cases Thursday — more than any other day in the pandemic.

Nearly 1,000 people died, pushing the death toll to more than 228,000 lives lost in the United States.
https://t.co/HDApatFHEV

name: NPR
text:
Cherie has been voting for nearly 30 years. She's organized a voter registration drive. This year, she and her daughter are working at the polls.

She says as a Black woman, she feels "duty-bound" to vote in honor of those before her who weren't allowed.
https://t.co/kIry7ol8g9

name: NPR
text:
On her sixth studio album — her third in three years — Ariana Grande emerges with a decidedly mature and distinct R&B sound, with features from Doja Cat, Ty Dolla $ign and The Weeknd.

Listen now:
https://t.co/8WnZfo6gzq

name: NPR
text: NPR’s final Electoral College map analysis shows Biden with a clear edge heading into the final days of the electio… https://t.co/swxB2Py0iZ

name: NPR
text: RT @ayesharascoe: Another rapper endorsed President Trump last night, just in time for my story about how the campaign is reaching out to Black voters https://t.co/VAHY2Yyg1i

name: NPR
text:
Emergency crews in Turkey and Greece are working to help people caught in a 7.0-magnitude earthquake that struck in the Aegean Sea on Friday. At least four people are dead in Turkey.
https://t.co/ifEOGAlCWE

name: NPR
text:
The Mandalorian's new installment deploys revelations about the Star Wars universe that keep fans guessing and engaged — topped by the reveal of a character that will make them squeal with anticipation and delight.

Here's the full review from @Deggans: https://t.co/Tnz8ZaWJYT

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprmusic: Join us at 2 p.m. ET for another NPR Music Listening Party as we revisit @Outkast's 20th anniversary reissue of 'Stankonia' with @redclayscholar, @WriteGavinWrite and @MinaAnnLee.

Details: https://t.co/gLC3QCRq0m

Tune in: https://t.co/hOPCTxcSzQ https://t.co/OnRccMAz75

name: NPR
text:
.@HowIBuiltThis host @GuyRaz is discussing resilience with entrepreneur and activist @VarshPrakash.

She's the co-founder and Exec. Director of @SunriseMvmt, a youth-led organization focused on climate change.

Join us! Supported by @hubspot. #hibtlive https://t.co/vEJhuofOZZ

name: NPR
text:
RT @rebeccalramirez: The last time there was a Halloween blue moon for *everyone* in the U.S. was 1944 — that's WWII!

But blue moons generally? not rare, usually every ~2.7 years.

Link to read/hear more: https://t.co/nKgJGFQF7V

#NPRShortWave

name: NPR
text:
The Louisville police officer who was shot during a botched raid that left Breonna Taylor dead is countersuing Taylor's boyfriend, accusing him of committing battery, assault and intentional emotional distress. 
https://t.co/JvPtuIOAbS

name: NPR
text:
RT @AubreyNPR: Mask dreams? Vivid dreams? #insomnia ? DM if u want to share. I'm reporting on new research on sleep/dreams amid #COVID19 

Here's some tips on getting a good night's sleep
https://t.co/xBeQjkz2Rz @NPRLifeKit https://t.co/IN26JE8MaT

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRCodeSwitch: "We need to acknowledge that Latinos are fully human, complicated political actors, rather than just pawns that are easily poached or persuaded, just because a politician talks to them."

Read more of our conversation with @gerry_cadava
here 👇 https://t.co/KuviTNPz9t

name: NPR
text:
Where are hospitals reaching capacity? Which metro areas are running out of beds?

NPR has learned federal agencies collect and analyze this information in detail — but don't share it with the public.
https://t.co/dhnBipvRc0

name: NPR
text:
Unable to get a visa to Iran, 2 American filmmakers relied on anonymous Iranian videographers who risked arrest to film Nasrin Sotoudeh.

The result is a documentary following the human rights lawyer from home to office to court and, ultimately, to prison. https://t.co/CF4KmoGt6Q

name: NPR
text: Update: At least 14 people are dead. The earthquake's worst effects are being reported in western Turkey, where officials said 12 people are dead and over 600 are injured. https://t.co/ifEOGAlCWE

name: NPR
text:
RT @Roughly: Could comparing the president to a #PairOfButtocks land you in prison? It depends on which president you’re talking about.

In our new episode w/ @eyderp: an activist and poet takes on corruption in Uganda with vulgar poems on Facebook and nude protests.

https://t.co/QKmvdO7GCe https://t.co/vOTrBm8RhN

name: NPR
text: RT @BobbyAllyn: New: Federal judge in Pennsylvania issues nationwide preliminary injunction blocking Trump’s Nov. 12 TikTok ban from going into effect. Judge calls Trump admin’s nat’l security concerns with TikTok “phrased in the hypothetical.” https://t.co/WMRDEN1ipCNew: Federal judge in Pennsylvania issues nationwide preliminary injunction blocking Trump’s Nov. 12 TikTok ban fro… https://t.co/DG4PXRoRDq

name: NPR
text:
If he joined Operation Warp Speed as a federal employee instead of a consultant, Moncef Slaoui would've had to divest his holdings with vaccine makers or recuse himself from decisions that pose a conflict.

As a consultant, he had the option to keep them. https://t.co/R21iB8k5Ta

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRLifeKit: If you're voting with a disability, remember: 
▪️ Polling places and systems must be accessible to you
▪️ Take the time you need
▪️ You can bring someone to help you vote

You'll want to have the contact information of legal advocates just in case. 

https://t.co/ZhQTen8pzD

name: NPR
text:
Walmart is returning guns and ammunition to its shelves after instructing stores on Wednesday to remove them from displays as a safety precaution, citing this week's "isolated civil unrest."
https://t.co/W9P20TSbzY

name: NPR
text:
Connecticut won't retry Michael Skakel, the Kennedy cousin previously accused of bludgeoning to death his 15-year-old neighbor.

Prosecutors say 17 of their 51 potential witnesses have died, making it hard to prove the 1975 case beyond a reasonable doubt. https://t.co/Yz7i5Nxwbw

name: NPR
text:
Texas and Hawaii are the first states to surpass 2016 voter turnout figures through early voting alone, says a political scientist who runs the U.S. Election Project.
 https://t.co/zt5IRsEewI

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Internal documents obtained by NPR show the federal government collects crucial coronavirus-related hospital data across the country that could be used to help communities prevent outbreaks — but the government is keeping the data hidden. https://t.co/nUtV7OoSmo
